definition: see 竭澤而漁|竭泽而渔[jie2 ze2 er2 yu2]
to dry/to dry up
pool/pond/(of metals etc) luster/favor or beneficence/damp/moist
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
fisherman/to fish
lit. to drain the pond to get at the fish (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to lack foresight
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
lit. eating away next year's food in advance/fig. to dip into the next month's check/live now, pay later
to have disastrous consequences
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
lit. to invert root and branch (idiom); fig. confusing cause and effect/to stress the incidental over the fundamental/to put the cart before the horse
to dig one's own grave
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
sudden huge profits
to have bad consequences
